Sequence Information.Peptide Name: K11 (Lys-rich; synthetic AMPs20, hybrid peptide, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: hybrid peptide, combined melittin, cecropin A1 and magainin 2 fragments, designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 75% similarity toCE-MA hybrid.  A hybrid of melittin, cecropin A1 and magainin 2. Active against Gram+ S. aureus CMCC26003 or MRSA (MIC 0.25-4 ug/mL), B. subtilis DB430 (MIC 2 ug/mL), S. epidermidis (MIC 0.5-8 ug/ml), B. pumilus CMCC63202 (MIC 0.5 ug/mL),  M. luteus CMCC28001 (MIC 2 ug/mL), Gram- E. coli ATCC8099 (MIC 0.5 ug/mL), K. pneumoniae CMCC46117 or clinical (MIC 0.5-4 ug/mL), S. paratyphi B CMCC50094 (MIC 2 ug/mL), P. aeruginosa CMCC10104 (MIC 1-8 ug/mL).Animal model:mouse: K11 also showed efficacy in wound healing (Rishi et al., 2018). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Jin-Jiang H1, Jin-Chun L, Min L, Qing-Shan H, Guo-Dong L.
Literature Information.Title: The Design and Construction of K11: A Novel alpha-Helical Antimicrobial Peptide
